00032 // Interface for Int32 type. 
00033 //
00034 // jhrg 9/7/94
00035 
00036 #ifndef _int32_h
00037 #define _int32_h 1
00038 
00039 #ifndef __POWERPC__
00040 #ifdef __GNUG__
00041 #pragma interface
00042 #endif
00043 #endif
00044 
00045 #ifndef _dods_datatypes_h
00046 #include "dods-datatypes.h"
00047 #endif
00048 
00049 #ifndef _basetype_h
00050 #include "BaseType.h"
00051 #endif
00052 
00058 class Int32: public BaseType {
00064     friend class Byte;
00065     friend class Int16;
00066     friend class UInt16;
00067     friend class UInt32;
00068     friend class Float32;
00069     friend class Float64;
00070 
00071 protected:
00072     dods_int32 _buf;
00073 
00074 public:
00075   Int32(const string &n = "");
00076 
00077   Int32(const Int32 &copy_from);
00078 
00079   Int32 &operator=(const Int32 &rhs);
00080 
00081   virtual ~Int32();
00082 
00083     virtual BaseType *ptr_duplicate();
00084     
00085   virtual unsigned int width();
00086 
00087   virtual bool serialize(const string &dataset, DDS &dds, XDR *sink,
00088                bool ce_eval = true);
00089     virtual bool deserialize(XDR *source, DDS *dds, bool reuse = false);
00090 
00091     virtual unsigned int val2buf(void *val, bool reuse = false);
00092     virtual unsigned int buf2val(void **val);
00093 
00094   virtual void print_val(ostream &os, string space = "",
00095              bool print_decl_p = true);
00096 
00097     virtual void print_val(FILE *out, string space = "",
00098                bool print_decl_p = true);
00099 
00100     virtual bool ops(BaseType *b, int op, const string &dataset);
00101 };

00165  * Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00166  * Many methods that returned error codes now throw exectptions. There are
00167  * two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00168  * InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00169  * the library. Error is used to reprot all other errors. Since InternalErr
00170  * is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.

00227  * source `object' (which is just an XDR pointer).

00260  * Removed card() member function.
00261  * Removed old, deprecated member functions.
00262  * Changed the names of read_val and store_val to buf2val and val2buf.
00263  *
00264  * Revision 1.10  1995/03/04  14:35:02  jimg
00265  * Major modifications to the transmission and representation of values:
00266  * Added card() virtual function which is true for classes that
00267  * contain cardinal types (byte, int float, string).
00268  * Changed the representation of Str from the C rep to a C++
00269  * class represenation.
00270  * Chnaged read_val and store_val so that they take and return
00271  * types that are stored by the object (e.g., inthe case of Str
00272  * an URL, read_val returns a C++ String object).
00273  * Modified Array representations so that arrays of card()
00274  * objects are just that - no more storing strings, ... as
00275  * C would store them.
00276  * Arrays of non cardinal types are arrays of the DODS objects (e.g.,
00277  * an array of a structure is represented as an array of Structure
00278  * objects).
00279  *
00280  * Revision 1.9  1995/02/10  02:22:42  jimg
00281  * Added DBMALLOC includes and switch to code which uses malloc/free.
00282  * Private and protected symbols now start with `_'.
00283  * Added new accessors for name and type fields of BaseType; the old ones
00284  * will be removed in a future release.
00285  * Added the store_val() mfunc. It stores the given value in the object's
00286  * internal buffer.
00287  * Made both List and Str handle their values via pointers to memory.
00288  * Fixed read_val().
00289  * Made serialize/deserialize handle all malloc/free calls (even in those
00290  * cases where xdr initiates the allocation).
00291  * Fixed print_val().
00292  *
00293  * Revision 1.8  1995/01/19  21:59:19  jimg
00294  * Added read_val from dummy_read.cc to the sample set of sub-class
00295  * implementations.
00296  * Changed the declaration of readVal in BaseType so that it names the
00297  * mfunc read_val (to be consistant with the other mfunc names).
00298  * Removed the unnecessary duplicate declaration of the abstract virtual
00299  * mfuncs read and (now) read_val from the classes Byte, ... Grid. The
00300  * declaration in BaseType is sufficient along with the decl and definition
00301  * in the *.cc,h files which contain the subclasses for Byte, ..., Grid.
